newsitem.title: NORWAY: Blue chip losses burden Oslo Total index.
newsitem.headline: Blue chip losses burden Oslo Total index.

text.p: Major industrial companies such as Norsk Hydro and Kvaerner fell on Monday to help depress the Norwegian stock exchange, dealers said.
The Oslo Total index dropped 0.51 percent to 878.56 points in healthy trade worth 740 million crowns, including 194 million crowns in Norsk Hydro, Norway's largest listed company.

Hydro slipped initially when the bourse opened after the industrial giant announced it's third-quarter result was down 45 percent because of lower prices for aluminium and petrochemicals. But the share recovered some lost ground to close 0.3 percent lower at 305 crowns.
The third-quarter announcement had been preceded by selling of Hydro shares last week.
Food-based conglomerate Orkla A shares were down 1.6 percent at 408.50 crowns in what a dealer attributed to profit-taking.

Kvaerner B shares fell 2.3 percent to 210 crowns to continue a downward spin from last Friday when shipping group Storli said it had cancelled an order for two chemical carriers from Kvaerner's Floroe yard.
